alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A nearly stationary storm producing heavy rain will impact portions of northwestern Montgomery and east central Stanly Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm near Badin Lake. This storm was nearly stationary. This storm has already produced up to 2 inches of rainfall. HAZARD...Heavy rain may produce localized flooding in poor drainage locations. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Badin Lake, Badin, Eldorado, Morrow Mountain State Park and Lake Tillery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
